meanings.definition: Having or showing doubt or skepticism.
meanings.sent1: She was septical about the new plan presented at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The scientist took a septical approach to the unusual results of the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a septical look at the new toy before cautiously approaching it.
meanings.sent4: His septical nature acted as a shield against falling for scams.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds overhead made her feel septical about having a picnic.

meanings.definition: A person who doubts or questions accepted opinions or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: As a septical, he always sought evidence before forming his own opinions.
meanings.sent2: The septical raised important questions during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The septical in the group made everyone rethink their assumptions.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the septical in the class for challenging the teacher's statements.
meanings.sent5: The septical's inquiries led to a deeper understanding of the topic.
